lines.text: [Watching the final scene of "Shane" on television]
Come back, Shane! Run for president!
I'm blacker than you are. I got some slave in me, I can feel it.

[handing Picker the scandalous information concerning his dealings with Reyes]
This is the only copy left. I want you to have it because it might help you to know what someone else may find. I shouldn't have looked for it. I'm really sorry.

Fuckin' cocaine. You know, I was really so successful at everything I did. Business, politics, hell, I could handle anything... except cocaine. Only I didn't know that because of cocaine. That's what really fucked up my marriage. It wasn't anything else. And...
[pause]
I did go to bed with 'Renzo once or twice. Hell, it was just a coke thing. I could do anything, so I did that too.
[pause]
I'm seeing a really nice woman now... I suppose I have to tell her.
[voice breaking]
Hell of a price to pay, isn't it?
Well, maybe no one will find out.
Well, you did... in a day. I should never have said yes to Mrs. Harris. But I liked what Harris was doing, and I thought I'd give it a week, and it just took off. Once I did that blood thing, God...

[interrupting]
... but that was great politics.

Yeah... amazing, wasn't it? Jack, I'd like to thank you for coming here, the honorable way you have. I was wrong to stay in. I just hope that maybe when I quit, they won't hit it as hard. And my boys, I really don't want them to know about 'Renzo. The problem is, the bottom line is, I'm going to be a national joke... and I'm going to have to explain it all to my boys... either way. Because no matter what I do, the press is still going to find out the rest of it, aren't they?
If they think it will sell one newspaper, yes.

[breaking down]
Oh, my God.

[putting his hand on Picker's shoulder]
If there's anything I can do... anything... that can make it a little better...
[stands and leaves as Picker weeps]
He's lost them.
Fuck 'em. He's got me.
We can do incredible things. We can change this country. I'm gonna win this thing. Look me in the eye, Henry, and tell me that you don't want to be a part of it.
[about Jack Stanton]
He's poked his pecker in some sorry trash bins.
[with a gun in her enemy's crotch]
I am a gay lesbian woman! I do not mythologize the male sexual organ!
[on the fealty of political bosses]
That's what these guys do. They love you and then stop lovin' you.
From now on you can call me the "Dust Buster." I'm stronger than dirt.
The only shot we have here is to be perfect.
I got a python in here...
[Richard unzips his pants and exposes himself to Jennifer at campaign office in front of everyone]

[awkwardly]
I've never seen one that... old... before
[Richard is stunned]

[softly]
Come on, Richard... let's just park that Mustang back in the garage
[leading him away]
I'm going to tell you something really outrageous. I'm going to tell you the truth.
Your grandfather was a great man. Jack Stanton could also be a great man, if he wasn't such a faithless, thoughtless, disorganized, undisciplined shit.
The media giveth, and go fuck yourself.
Mister, you're about to become Missus.

[about the cellphone]
You wouldn't have found it if I hadn't thrown it out the car!
Hey fuck you!
Fuck me? Fuck you, you redneck son of a bitch!
That's how history is made, Henry - by the first-timers.
Isn't that the thing experience teaches you? Not to get burned?
Does anyone ever learn that?
Not the best people.

You know as well as I do, that plenty of people playing this game, they don't think that way. They're willing to sell their souls, crawl through sewers, lie to people, divide them, play on their worst fears for nothing! Just for the prize.
